website_summaries.verdict: Sperry is one of the definitive footwear brands for the preppy and the upper class. The Striper II Salt Washed CVO cements this image with its smart aesthetic that redefines casual style. The fabric upper is balanced by rawhide laces that add a dressy tone to the footwear.Adding to the shoe’s visual points are the neutral shades of each colorway that make the sneaker the perfect accessory all-year-round. It provides a good fit, is comfortable, and lightweight. It does run big, but the shoe is a good buy overall.
pros: The nice combination of dressy and casual style of the Sperry Striper II Salt Washed CVO got the most nods from reviewers
They also mentioned how much they liked the leather laces which dress the shoe up
The level of comfort in this Sperry low-top shoe has gotten the second most number of mentions and praises from users
Several testers commended the Striper II Salt Washed CVO sneaker for being well-constructed and built to last
Some delighted users described how the casual footwear provided a good fit even for people with wide foot widths
A handful of customers were pleased with the colorways available for the Sperry model
They added that the shades were “perfect for all seasons.”
One person stated that the Sperry Striper II Salt Washed CVO felt much lighter than the original Striper CVO model
cons: A good number of reviewers reported that the Sperry Striper II Salt Washed CVO runs big
Several people mentioned that you have to wear socks with the low-top Sperry sneaker
Otherwise, the shoe will dig into your ankles
They added that the brand’s removal of the padding from the back of the shoe caused this issue

customer_reviews.title: Try them on in the store first. Please.
customer_reviews.text: This shoe looks really nice, but it digs into the back of your heel giving you blisters very quickly. The tip of the heel of the shoe literally feels like its scraping you. The sole is much too soft, which sounds counter-intuitive (wouldn't you want a softer sole?) but it feels like walking on spongy yoga mats instead of a proper shoe. The actual tread is very soft, which I'm sure gives great grip but it wears out fast. I only wore this shoe for 1 day and I count my lucky stars that I was able to return it. Sperry didn't do the proper research on this one.
customer_reviews.author: kj

customer_reviews.title: Good for high top arches and wide feet
customer_reviews.text: These shoes/sneakers are nice to look at and I am very impressed at the comfort level. I was careful not to pull the strings (they're leather) so as not to snap them, so I wear them sort of loose. I have high top arches so this works to my advantage. Also, plenty of room for someone with an E width for sure.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Great canvas shoe
customer_reviews.text: These fit and feel great. I was worried about these shoes being too narrow and/or the arch being too flat, but they worked out well. Vans have always been my go to canvas shoes, but I found that as I get older Vans tend to hurt my feet. These shoes were my first attempt at replacing my Vans and I am very happy with the results. I get the canvas sneaker look in shoes that fit my feet well and don't hurt after hours of walking.
customer_reviews.author: Brian S

customer_reviews.title: Better than original Striper CVO sneaker
customer_reviews.text: Disagree with some of the reviews about shoe being too heavy. On the contrary these are much lighter than the original Striper CVO sneakers I've bought in the past. Just received them so time will tell how durable they are. I've never been a huge fan of boat shoes but need something dressy casual to wear with shorts in the summer. The leather laces make these a nice dress casual alternative. I might even have to get a second pair in Navy! Great looking shoe.
customer_reviews.author: WhippetLove

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and squeaky - caused foot pain
customer_reviews.text: The soles are very thin and the insole is squeaky and squishy. Very little support in this shoe has led to a lot of foot pain, mainly plantar fasciitis in my left foot. The soles are so unlike the Halyards that I also have that I somewhat doubt I received an authentic product. I have a hard time believing that Sperry could get away with selling such a flimsy, squeaky shoe in a retail store.
customer_reviews.author: mimthedwarf

customer_reviews.title: Nice style...rubbed my heels
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this shoe. I ordered it to wear to a business casual wedding. The fit was fine for the most part. I have decently wide feet, but these shoes didn't feel cramped in the mid-foot or toe box. The style was nice and materials felt premium. The problem is, these shoes rubbed my heels. I wore them with standard quarter length socks and they just weren't comfortable after a couple hours of light walking around a wedding and reception. If they added a bit of padding to the heel, I think I would've been fine. Unfortunately I had to return them. If you don't experience the heel rubbing, then I think you'll enjoy these just fine!
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Danger

customer_reviews.title: Width too big for my taste
customer_reviews.text: The length of the shoe is pretty accurate I wear size 10, ordered a size 10 and it fit well except for the width. The width of the shoe is too big which caused it to fold very easily as I walked. I don’t think I would order this particular style again. I have bought the Sperry Bahama II boat sneaker in white and the style fit very well in the boat sneaker , width was perfect for me. Not impressed with this style & fit.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Looks Great, Wear Thick Socks
customer_reviews.text: Very nice shoes. I’m on the fence regarding the square shoelaces. Also, make sure to wear thick socks because it will dig into your ankles pretty hard.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy M

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I love sperry shoes, specifically the Top-Siders. I have several pairs. The Washed Canvas is a good color for casual and above-casual outfits. The leather laces are great but can come untied if not tightened properly. The material actually looks greyish, at times and I can see the canvas becoming dirty quickly if not cared for. Overall, I love them. Sperry makes a good shoe. Now if they would bring back the dark navy blue with the red stripe...
customer_reviews.author: Brian K

customer_reviews.title: Cute but painful
customer_reviews.text: These shoes look great—I got two pairs in different colors. I love the style, but they are definitely not comfortable. The heel tab is very hard and rubs the skin right where the foot bends, so that every time I walk in them for more than a couple of hours they give me blisters, often to the point of bleeding. I honestly can’t wear these shoes without placing a bandaid on my heel first. And I don’t have sensitive feet—I do lots of biking/running/jumping in my other older sneakers with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mike R

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable! I have a hard time with shoes fitting ...
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable! I have a hard time with shoes fitting properly...and the "wide" size was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Nick A. Milazzo

customer_reviews.title: Good Looking Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I really like these shoes. They are a classic look and look good with both pants and shorts with no show socks. I will advise that you will blister the back heel working them in if you where a short sock. They do show dust, but easy enough to clean by slapping the dust out of the blue! haha The inner liner is already starting to peel from the edges though. thought this wouldn't happen so soon. I currently haven't worn them but perhaps a dozen times and have not washed them yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy S

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I've always had good luck with Sperry's but not this pair. I've been wearing them for 2 months now and they just won't get comfortable. The rear support still digs into the back of my heel and I ordered my normal size. Thought they might break in after a week or two but it's not happening. Wish I could return them!
customer_reviews.author: S. Caton

customer_reviews.title: Look great but pinch toes
customer_reviews.text: I've gotten several complements on these shoes but I cannot wear them anymore. I ordered a wide size just to be sure, since you never know when ordering shoes. These are a wide fit, so that was good, but the construction of the toe box is way too short. My toes scrape against the upper whenever I walk. When I'm not moving they are fine, but any movement it feels like my small toe is trying to scrape out of the canvas. I thought they would lessen uo over time, but wearing them today I had to run in them for the first time and nearly stopped and took them off it was so bad.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Looks fashionable. There were two points within the shoes that actually rubbed against my calcaneus - the heel which cut into my skin. I purchased sockless socks to solve the matter. Shoes can be washed in the washer. But shouldn't cost $40, more like $20. I wouldn't recommend unless you have an orthopedic surgeon/podiatrist in your family.
customer_reviews.author: Ravi Peiris M.D.

customer_reviews.title: Stylish, Comfortable, What More Is There?
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable and stylish shoes. I went through a couple different brands before stumbling on these shoes. I get uncomfortable without good Nike-style arch support and my heels are pretty sensitive to chafing from stiff shoe backs. Not only did these shoes have the style I was looking for, but they delivered tons in arch support and overall comfort. No chafing, and the shoe had a nice, snug-but-not-tight fit. The bottom of the shoe feels like it’s made of pillow. I’ve gotten a number of compliments on them already, and they go pretty well with a business casual or academic look. 10/10!
customer_reviews.author: Gabe Moule

customer_reviews.title: Wow, these shoes are awesome 100%
customer_reviews.text: I've only had them on for about an hour but they are really really comfy, maybe the best fitting shoe I've ever put on. They have this odd arch support that works really well and are roomy to accommodate a normal foot (as opposed to most shoes I've tried). My back has been killing me for a few weeks and after walking my dog to the park in these, it hasn't felt better (which is probably an indication my other shoes are junk lol). I highly recommend these and will update this review if the shoes go south in any way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Design changed - does not fit as well as older ones
customer_reviews.text: I bought the same wide size I bought last time (3 years ago?) but these are not so good and do not fit. They have added elastic across the top, although the laces are still there. When I choose lace up, I expect lace up. I need "wide" sizes not because my feet are actually very wide, but because my instep is unusually high, so more material overall is needed to accommodate that. 10.5 EEE is my normal size, but they only have a "W" width, so I need 11 W in this type of shoe. The elastic ruins that. It is way too tight and very uncomfortable. Lace up shoes should not have elastic over the instep as well.
customer_reviews.author: peasmould

customer_reviews.title: Reliable shoe with the option replace insoles
customer_reviews.text: These shoes served me well on my cruise and matched nearly anything I wore. I like that the insoles are cushion, makes them more comfortable for longer walks. I also like the insoles are replaceable in case you need to swap it for something that has more arch support. Great show.
customer_reviews.author: Mama'sPoBoy

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, Horrible quality!!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes may fit right but the quality is HORRIBLE.. My husband had them for less than a week and the shoe laces broke, and the shoe startes to completely come apart. He works an office job, but the way they fell apart you would have thought he tried to run a marathon in these shoes. I'm seriously wondering if these to fake Sperry's.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa

customer_reviews.title: Much improved.
customer_reviews.text: These are easier than the Striper I. I have both. Striper I is a bit bulkier and actually has to be broken in. Not so for II. II is more of a casual shoe. I prefer it. One of only a few sneakers that are offered in wide; to my knowledge there are no other makers offering deck sneakers in wide.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Margello

customer_reviews.title: Where did Sperry quality go?
customer_reviews.text: I have not bought a pair of Sperry in decades because I have not had a boat. Now that I have a boat I knew that I needed some deck shoes. In the past Sperry made the best canvas topsiders, they were comfortable out of the box. These new ones have rub points and hard stitching that is going to take quite a bit of time to brake in. Sad, but the reality of the new world I guess, craftsmanship is not a priority.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis F. Franklin

customer_reviews.title: these aren’t sperry shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Sperry shoes usually are good shoes in my experience but these are either complete garbage or knockoffs. The laces on the shoes snapped when I adjusted them so I replaced them then the run sides of the right shoe started to fall off and separate from the toe box. And the cherry on top? The insoles started falling apart as well. I like sperry shoes but these should be abandoned by the sperry shoe line all together. Luckily I can send mine back still but unfortunately they have lost my business.
customer_reviews.author: ALVA

customer_reviews.title: Good boat shoes, as described, fit well
customer_reviews.text: Good pair of boat shoes. The back cut into my heel the first few times I wore them, but it softens up pretty easily without looking like its soft. Good materials. They need a little breaking in before taking them on the boat, but overall, pretty darn good for a pair of $35 shoes. Not a terrible fan of the color, but it's what I ordered - it was the cheapest, so not a real complaint. Just wish the black canvas was the same price!
customer_reviews.author: John L

customer_reviews.title: Great but they run a little small
customer_reviews.text: They are everything they looked like they would be. The only thing is, you might consider getting a half size larger than your normal size. I don't know if they run small or what. They are constructed with an elastic band across the top of the show under the laces. This is a nice enhancement but it makes the shoe pretty hard to get on and a snug fit for your normal size. Otherwise, I'm very pleased with the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: David Reneau

customer_reviews.title: The most uncomfortable shoes I have ever bought
customer_reviews.text: I should have known better. I was seduced by the appearance of the shoes. Even though the size is correct these shoes are very uncomfortable The heel is too low and the bottom of the shoes feel lumpy. My wife reminded me that I have 2 pairs of Sperry shoes in the closet that I have seldom worn. I just threw them in the trash today.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wong

customer_reviews.title: The shoes are very good.. I've never been disappointed with sperrys
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are very good.. I've never been disappointed with sperrys.. They're built to last... Especially if you use them only for casual wear like school or out on the town.. Overall they are very good colorwise and fit perefect
customer_reviews.author: Randy S

customer_reviews.title: A bit tight, but hubby likes them
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband, who likes the style of them. He complained that they were a bit tight and hard to lace up. I plan to switch the leather laces for traditional ones, and they have stretched, as Sperry's do, with wear. If you/hubby have bulging toes or other funny feet shapes, I would suggest sizing up a half size.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah James

customer_reviews.title: Finding heal to be rough and firm
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan of these as the back heal pushes in to the skin and is very firm/rough causing blisters and bleeding. I wear no show socks but it doesn't help. Haven't had this issue with other brands, maybe it is a defect with the pair I got. I dunno.
customer_reviews.author: S. Konz

customer_reviews.title: For working on metal roofs
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these sneakers to work / install solar panels on my metal roof. Excellent traction on damp and dry metal roofs. Non-marring and soft on the roof. Wear a fall prevention harness anyway with these sneakers while working on a roof.
customer_reviews.author: Saint Jay

customer_reviews.title: Size down
customer_reviews.text: First time wearing this type of shoe. The cushion is better than what I was expecting which is pretty good. Width and everything is fine. Only complaint is that the shoe runs big. I bought 9 1/2 but it fits somewhere between 10 and 10 1/2. So, if you get one, size at least half a size down.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy N.

customer_reviews.title: My go to pair for class
customer_reviews.text: These have become a staple in my choice of shoes. I personally enjoy these Sperry designs and comfort more than Vans. However, I don’t recommend wearing them if you’re walking around a lot. Perfect for going to class or if you’re worried about walking into buildings with slippery floors when it rains.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Bonnell

customer_reviews.title: Cut my heels
customer_reviews.text: So, I have a pair of Sperry shoes. They're worn out, but comfy. Needed to replace them so I bought these. They're so sharp/scratchy on the back that they cut into my heel and I basically bled out into them. So, I can't return them, but I definitely need different shoes. I thought the point of these shoes was to wear them with no-show socks. But, even with regular socks they still scrape and cut. Please refund me.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph T Dzado

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful color and style but not for tall & wide feet
customer_reviews.text: They are great to look at but they are too long in the toe and not quite wide/tall enough for the top of the foot. I ordered my normal size. The label shows the size I ordered. Still, not the great fit that I expected. Love the leather laces and color.
customer_reviews.author: AnonymousOne

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and value
customer_reviews.text: Nice style, and can be worn as lace-up or slip-on without laces. There is an elastic band under the tongue of the shoe. Great quality as one would expect from Sperry. Good fit and need little breaking in. Good value on sale.
customer_reviews.author: M. FUSCO

customer_reviews.title: Great for fat feet
customer_reviews.text: These are the only plain white sneakers I can find for my stupid fat feet. Vans? no Keds? no New Balance? nope. These are great with a classic, basic look. P.S. get these with the foam footbed and not the original striper (that one's just cardboard).
customer_reviews.author: al

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart
customer_reviews.text: Ok I was excited to have sperrys, it was great to have them arrive but to start they were larger than expected. I kept them though and have been wearing them, but they have been wearing out like cray recently. There are multiple holes that have worn into it, the sperrys logo on the back of the right food is tearing off, and the siding is starting to separate from the shoes. Unless I can get these replaced for super fast wear and tear then this was kind of a bust purchase. Shoes are made to be worn and if they fall apart because you wear them as your normal shoes then they aren't worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Junglebunns

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is bad. "Wide" is not wide
customer_reviews.text: Sizing is bad. "Wide" is not wide; length (11) is at least one inch shorter than other Sperry deck shoes I own. Order at least one fully size up than your normal shoe. I don't think it's available but if you take "wide" get double wide
customer_reviews.author: Dan LWR

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: What a waste of money. These are already falling apart after only 1 month. Of course I’m 2 days outside the return window. Shipping was quick so seller wasn’t fine in that respect but the product is obviously a knockoff and not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: C. E. Rusk

customer_reviews.title: I love that these shoes are orthotic friendly.
customer_reviews.text: I love how these shoes look and fit. They are extremely comfortable. I'm able to remove the standard foot bed, and replace it with my prescription orthotics. I wear 13 wide. The shoes don't look wide to the eye, but fit great.
customer_reviews.author: A2SuperCrew

customer_reviews.title: Started to fall apart after a month of occasional wear
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes for about a month, then something in the right sole was “clicking” the center sole is separating from the side, causing the rubber to pop in and out of its home making a clicking sensation while walking.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff T.

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. Non-marking heel so great for boating. Got a bit muddy once(ATV-ing) and I was able to wash them without any problems. The soles pulled right out to my surprise and it was easy enough to remove the laces. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Fit is really loose
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size eight...they sent what they said was an eight, but it is really loose. The worse part are the laces that came with the shoes. Looking for a pair of white laces to change out the originals.
customer_reviews.author: Pelican59

customer_reviews.title: Rough on the heels...
customer_reviews.text: I wear no-show socks and I could not break the heel of this shoe in. They consistently dug into my heels and broke skin (even on short walks). Would not recommend unless you are wearing socks that cover the heels or really tough feet. Shoe met all my expectations (perfect fit, looks good) other than the heel issue.
customer_reviews.author: A.E.

customer_reviews.title: Takes some breaking in
customer_reviews.text: The sole and cushion within the shoes are great, and they look great on the outside. However, it does require some breaking in and I certainly wouldn't advise wearing these to do any sort of lengthy walking right out of the box. Both of my heels got blisters from the back of the shoes, but that's really not that uncommon with brand new shoes. I'm sure they'll be great once I've developed a bit of a callous on the back of my heels.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Deteriorates over time
customer_reviews.text: I bought these approximately 6 months ago, and while they look great and go with so many outfits, they have deteriorated in quality over time with frequent use. The canvas on the top of the shoe developed "lines", where it looks like the dye faded away from friction or something. Also, the seams on the sides of the shoes have begun to separate from the canvas. However, since these were only $35, I'm pretty satisfied with the shoes overall.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Gill

customer_reviews.title: Quality is lacking. Lasted 3 months before seam broke
customer_reviews.text: Originally ordered this in 9. It was too small, so had it replaced for 9.5. Received on 4/3/19. I wear these shoes about once a week and by 6/2/19, the end ripped. I use a shoe horn to put my shoes on.
customer_reviews.author: GDubya

customer_reviews.title: Decent shoe for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This shoe isn’t bad at all, the heel rubs a bit on me but nothing unbearable. Looks nice but picks up dirt a little easy. The leather laces are a really nice addition.
customer_reviews.author: Reverend Tubby

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing quality
customer_reviews.text: Great looking shoe, but the top of the heel area is stiff with sharp angles. I’ve tried wearing no show socks like I do with the same style but a different brand. The sharp edges cut into my heels and caused both of them to bleed. Recommended wearing with taller socks or going with a different brand!
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod W.

customer_reviews.title: comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is comfortable. The shoe is flexible so the toe box will stretch and give you a little more room if you need it. I recommend some good no show socks to prevent discomfort in the achilles region of the foot.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Shoe fit
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to get your foot in it due to the tongue being seen in place, better have a shoe horn or cut the tongue loose, which is what I did. Overall a nice shoe.
customer_reviews.author: LESTER VAN STEENBURGH

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable and I was told after buying them that they are fashionable. Fits well. Not sure what else I'm supposed to say about shoes...
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Very good looking shoe
customer_reviews.text: Very attractive shoe and comfortable however it wears about longer than most shoes so you might feel you’re feet slide forwards and backwards when you walk
customer_reviews.author: Abdullah Siddiqui

customer_reviews.title: Ok Shoe not a fan of the laces though
customer_reviews.text: The Shoe looks excellent, and so do the laces, but the laces are so useless. Their to thick and you can't tie them without them looking really large.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Mace

customer_reviews.title: Comfy! Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed actually. Very soft and squishy/comfy. The leather strap seem to be real leather so they kind shed a little. Overall I really like them!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is hard to please and normally won't wear new shoes until we are throwing away his old ones. He has separation anxiety when it comes to "stuff". But he is wearing these and he really likes them. Sperry is a great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: AnnapolisGirly

customer_reviews.title: Cut up my heel
customer_reviews.text: These shoes cut up my heels so badly they were unwearable. I have owned Sperry shoes in the past which I loved. They were super comfortable and I did not have any heel issues. Not sure what is different about these but they are definitely unlike any Sperry shoes I owned previously.
customer_reviews.author: J H

customer_reviews.title: Construction defect in the heal of the left shoe
customer_reviews.text: Loved the fit, but a construction defect in the heal band of the left shoe wore a cut in my foot in a single wearing. Ouch. Bought these as comfortable shoes. Company provided a full refund without hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and cool
customer_reviews.text: Basically as advertised. They seem to run a little bit bigger than most, but nothing crazy, maybe just a half size. Extremely comfortable and milk brea experience comfortable and look fresh
customer_reviews.author: William Boldt

customer_reviews.title: Casual and stylish!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good looking comfortable shoe, I was missing a casual shoe in my closet and these go well with everything.
customer_reviews.author: James L.

customer_reviews.title: It fits way too big for me
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a 10-10.5 depending on the type of material and the brand of these shoes. I feel like I would have to bump down to at least a 9.5 to be comfortable in these.
customer_reviews.author: JoeB846

customer_reviews.title: Cute... but hell on the heel.
customer_reviews.text: Style wise, this shoe met my expectations. Where it fell short was in heel comfort. Two days wearing it (with socks) and my heel is raw.
customer_reviews.author: markro87

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable.  Not a fan of the laces.
customer_reviews.text: Great comfortable shoe. Only miss is the shoelaces. They are stiff leather that tend to stick out instead of laying flat.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Valmore

customer_reviews.title: Non-scuff sneakers
customer_reviews.text: Sperry makes good sneakers and boating shoes. They have always been more expensive than Keds, for example, but they hold up and wear longer if properly cared for.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Heyl

customer_reviews.title: They'll last you a long time.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have lasted me 9 months of intense wear. They're starting to show their age now but it's not surprising given how frequently I have worn them around town. They're stylish with light colored khakis. You might have trouble going down hills because there isn't any arch support, but as much should be expected from shoes of this style. No real complaints; these shoes have done their job for longer than I would've imagined.
customer_reviews.author: Gunnar Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Somethings Not Right
customer_reviews.text: Scrapes the back of your heel to the point where it is too painful to even wear them.
customer_reviews.author: xamazonx

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Shoe
customer_reviews.text: A pair of Sperrys for this price, yes please! I’m a size 11 and 11 fit perfectly, and they are very comfortable as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes. Very stylish, and surprisingly comfortable, (just make sure you wear socks at least to break them in). And not as expensive as you'd think. But as with any white shoes, they are not for the faint of heart when it comes to keeping them clean... Pro tip: toothbrush and toothpaste for the rubbery bits and Tide To Go for the canvas ;)
customer_reviews.author: Jack G

customer_reviews.title: Not truly wide width
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 11 wide in which I have several pair of Sperry brand wide width shoes that fit great. These do not fit at all. They also have elastic bands that connect the tongue to the shoes which was not noted in the description. Very disappointed that these do not fit as I was looking forward to a different style of Sperrys other than the few styles of boat shoes I currently have.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrod Carter

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad look but...
customer_reviews.text: Size runs a bit small, and you will want a shoe horn to put them on easily because the heel back is flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon D Leszczynski

customer_reviews.title: Fit as expected
customer_reviews.text: We went up half a size based on reviews - it was unnecessary and shoes were then too big and had to be returned and reordered.
customer_reviews.author: Amy M. Hoffmann

customer_reviews.title: Good looking too tight for Wide foot
customer_reviews.text: The shoe was decent looking, but too tight and elderly Father could not get a wide even on his foot. Eleastic way too tight...
customer_reviews.author: Genita Cartwright

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed or manufactured
customer_reviews.text: The shoe started cutting into my left heel with just a few hours of wear. And most of that was just spent sitting, only a few hundred yards of walking. This happened only on the left side. This is the second pair of Sperrys this has happened with. I was hoping it was just a fluke the first time. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: pl

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, feels good
customer_reviews.text: These are the same Sperry's I have had in the past and they feel great. Dress them up or down- made well, and arrived a couple days late- not sure why.
customer_reviews.author: LLouise

customer_reviews.title: Nice flat shoe
customer_reviews.text: Nice flat shoe purchased in wide fits nicely I don't expect a lot of comfort from a flat shoe. It's a nice upgrade from white tennis shoes to wear with jeans. Sperry is well-known brand and it's looks a classic.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Sick grey boat shoes
customer_reviews.text: That’s what they call them right? Whatever they call them they look good and fit well. Great price too.
customer_reviews.author: J. Roman

customer_reviews.title: nice looking shoe, but ouch!
customer_reviews.text: The heel is high and stiff and it cut into my ankle and caused me to bleed - red blood and white shoes are a terrible combination.
customer_reviews.author: richard sansom

customer_reviews.title: New sperrys
customer_reviews.text: These are actually more comfortable than my previous sperrys. The sole has some support. Like them a lot.
customer_reviews.author: mbean

customer_reviews.title: Sole separated in about 21 days.
customer_reviews.text: After about 3 weeks total of wearing these shoes the sole separated from the side walls. I’ve had several pairs before, but this has never happened. Not so great.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy B.

customer_reviews.title: Built to fall apart after a month
customer_reviews.text: These are garbage, they never got wet and only got casual use for a month and the soles are coming apart on both sneakers in multiple places. They last just long enough so you can't return them. Do not buy this product
customer_reviews.author: Peter Arsenault

customer_reviews.title: Poor build quality
customer_reviews.text: I've had these shoes for 5 months as of 7/1/19. The left shoe has completely ripped apart, and is now unwearable. Every layer has ripped apart from each other. Very disappointed in Sperry. Fits great though.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Embrey

customer_reviews.title: Buy them now!
customer_reviews.text: What a steal! They look great and feel very comfortable. They are perfect for someone who needs arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Doherty

customer_reviews.title: Great Present for the Man in Your Life
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a sneaker man, but he works in business, so I wanted to surprise him with nice shoes that were also comfortable. This was his first pair of Sperry's and they fit great and were very comfy for his feet.
customer_reviews.author: TeacherCoach

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are wide and kind of look chunky on the sides. The shoe laces (leather) are uncomfortable if you tie them and tuck them in the shoes. The laces will also become untied if tucked into the shoe while you're walking. I wear these occasionally at school, and they definitely aren't walking shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Finkner

customer_reviews.title: Great summer shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a lightweight summer shoe for a while now and these really knocked it out of the park. Only downside is the complete lack of any arch support, but that's to be expected from a canvas shoe. I swapped out the insoles for orthotics and they really did the job.
customer_reviews.author: J S

customer_reviews.title: Accurate Sizing
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of sperry's, I guess I've been missing out for all these years. I'm a big fan of these so far!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler B

customer_reviews.title: A bit larger than expected
customer_reviews.text: Maybe should've sized down a bit but the shoe is a bit larger than what I would've liked. I got an 11W and there's plenty of extra room in the toe box. Might want to order a size half smaller than usual if you go wide
customer_reviews.author: Judiel

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Really like the shoes so far. Got them a half size smaller based on other reviews and they're perfect. Have also gotten a bunch of compliments on them already.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C

customer_reviews.title: Blister on both heels within 5min of wear
customer_reviews.text: This shoes suffer from poor construction and workmanship (made in China) the seams are miss aligned at the heel causing a rough area. These shoes wore a hole in my socks and a blister on both my heels within 5 min after putting them on. Do not buy you will experience the same.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Frakes

customer_reviews.title: Great looks but a little more narrow than expected.
customer_reviews.text: I like the color, I like the feel. I wish it were wider and I wish it had some sort of arch support (I just learned that I need it with these shoes).
customer_reviews.author: Thugnacious D

customer_reviews.title: Makes noises with each step
customer_reviews.text: There is some sort of clicking sound like adhesive pulling apart every step i take. It's maddening. Comfortable otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick S.

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my boyfriend. He was a little Skeptical because they’re not quasi style. Now these are pretty much all he wears because they are so comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Kaethe Slomski

customer_reviews.title: Dyes Transfer
customer_reviews.text: The insole is a dark blue that transferred to my socks. The dye did not come out in the wash. Using a transferable dye on the insole is a poor design choice. I like the shoes, but they are a bit bigger than my other Sperry's.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Redd

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Fits will with good traction. However, the back of the shoe is a bit high and rubs a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Good summer shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for "summer" shoes. In the garden, mowing and even for a relaxed but nice look also.
customer_reviews.author: Acarroll

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Really good price for these. My husband swears by these shoes. The color is very nice
customer_reviews.author: Squid466

customer_reviews.title: Overall good but the shoelaces both snapped within weeks, even during quarantine
customer_reviews.text: The shoes look great and are very comfortable, but both shoelaces have had to be replaced after only a handful of wears, even during a quarantine when I'm only going out once a week and wearing other shoes half the time
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Not a true wide width
customer_reviews.text: For a wide with shoe, they are narrower than expected. My foot is a regular size 9e and they are tight across the metatarsal on the left and right sides.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Murray

customer_reviews.title: what you would hope to expect of deck shoes
customer_reviews.text: It is difficult to get into them, I have to untie the shoelaces to get them on.
customer_reviews.author: John A Ledbetter

customer_reviews.title: OH, THEY FRESH
customer_reviews.text: So, I forgot I was wearing white shoes and got them dirty day one. But am still in love with them. I’m not in love with the ipa’s I drank to forget I was wearing them when I decided to walk in the woods.... but love the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: TJ RENISON

product_meta.title: Sperry Top-Sider Men's Striper Ii CVO Washed Black Trainers
feature_bullets: Removable full-length molded PU footbed for all day comfort
Lightweight, flexible vulcanized construction with secure bonding between upper and outsole
Non-marking rubber outsoles with molded Wave-Siping for superior wet/dry traction
